Articles.Content:
This challenge is simple. Try to go as fast as possible, within the atmosphere. Screenshots for proof.

RULES:

Stay under 65km.

No airhogging (I'll say only 2 intakes per engine)

You can use rockets, but this gives you a disadvantage as your craft will be heavier.

Any size craft, but it must be manned.

No debug menu cheats, except for part clipping.

Must give a screenshot for proof of speed.

And lastly, HAVE FUN!

Speeds:

ihtoit: 6799 m/s

nicky4096 :5656 m/s

worir4: 1612 m/s

Scoreboard:

1.) ihtoit! Awarded 10/10 points for ludicrous speed

2.) nicky4096! Awarded 9.5/10 points for interesting design, plus speed.

3.) worir4! Awarded 7/10 points for kerbals that can face the heat of the burning atmosphere, plus an ok speed.

Edited December 29, 2014 by 88theturbo

ill compete, 2300 m/s with only 1 intake (was actually a machingbird try):

Javascript is disabled. View full album

later ill try 2 intakes and then a rocket thing

EDIT: OOPS i am so dumb. i went all the way to space in that thing >.<

so i do not count, went over 65 km. will retry later

Edited December 26, 2014 by nicky4096
Bonus points for external Kerbals?

well, i re-tried and got a decent speed of 1971 m/s. i am FAR from the limit though, i still have to add more fuel for the mainsail (yay for droptanks!), add more jet engines, etc.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

only mod used is time control, to make things run closer to real time. shouldnt affect flight, but if you *really* want, i can re-do in a clean install.

2,912 m/s over land. ill re-do because it was a horrible run

Javascript is disabled. View full album

i am certanly having fun

again only used mod is time control.
i re-did and hit 2992 m/s over land. but i will not rest until i have passed mach 10

MACH 16.622! (ASL)

5656 m/s. while doing it, i discovered the most epic thing in ksp: you can get reentry flames at 40 km! if you go fast enough.

i also accidentaly put myself on an escape trajectory... but i ended the flight before going over even 50 km

Javascript is disabled. View full album

ok, went for a 6-engined behemoth (with about 100 fuel between them, and 12 intakes), hit Kerbolar escape before I hit 50km, went for a screenshot and ksp had the weirdest bitvomit ever.

Will try again.

ok, went for a 6-engined behemoth (with about 100 fuel between them, and 12 intakes), hit Kerbolar escape before I hit 50km, went for a screenshot and ksp had the weirdest bitvomit ever.

Will try again.

doesnt it suck when ksp goes nuts?

doesnt it suck when ksp goes nuts?

Yep. Sscreenshots of a non-entry that I think should qualify for a Gatecrasher Award since I did manage over 4 miles a second IN ATMOSPHERE!

Basically, stock cockpit, stock LFO tank, stock wings, MechJeb for info, and my 320kN nuclear engine thanks to Luvodicus and his incredible foresight in building a version agnostic part! This is the plane at 20km already burning over a mile a second, I'm having to pitch DOWN by 5 degrees at this point to try and keep it from pitching straight up!

Just in case you can't see that, the odometer does in fact read 6799.5m/s, at 60km altitude, and that's surface speed not orbital velocity.

The final resting place for the spaceplane is a rescue orbit around Kerbol of 3.4Gmx23.4Gm. There is fuel left but no power so I can't orient the thing.

Edited December 29, 2014 by ihtoit
Thank you guys for taking this challenge on!

thanks for updating the board

not that im complaining, im happy to beat 6 km/s, but the challenge says stock, and ihtoit used a modded nuke engine.

ill see if i can beat it in stock anyway

i suspect jeb messed with the blueprints...

http://imgur.com/cUzLq4C

I decided to give this a little try, going fast is far too much fun

Javascript is disabled. View full album

8732 m/s on my first run. There is huge room for improvement so I hope to see more.

So...

I decided to take the challenge, and I eventually came out with this:

If you look closely, that IS 2 intakes per engine. I pwomise.

But at he time the game was lagging really hard, I pressed space, and the space Kraken Let all Hail upon me, and before I knew it:

What,

This is what happens, and I'm somewhat proud. this speed WAS GAINED IN THE ATMOSPHERE but it quickly excellerated out. It was also spinning insanely fast. Also notice Kirrim Kerman from Danny2462, yay!

BUT I DID IT. I DONT CARE!

but I'm not sure this counts, if it does, please put it on the leaderboard.
